repositories.brief_summary: Active week with significant memory model fixes, stdlib additions, and typechecker improvements merged to trunk
repositories.new_features_summary: Added List.split_map function, fixed Weak.set memory model, improved functor error messages, %identity nonexpansive
repositories.new_features:
- **Memory model fix** for `Weak.set` by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) addresses data race vulnerabilities in concurrent usage ([#14209](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14209), [0f6fbaea61b55a8c81c2ad299e093138b34dc8ea](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/0f6fbaea61b55a8c81c2ad299e093138b34dc8ea))
- **New `List.split_map` function** added to stdlib by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) that combines map and split operations without intermediate allocations ([#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185), [3c36ad0446dd1649444d16dfa64320cf92caf923](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/3c36ad0446dd1649444d16dfa64320cf92caf923))
- **Functor error message improvement** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provides clearer diagnostics when a functor is its own unsafe functor ([#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201), [1ac6152ec7becb7a29ef69b9b42ff78effb19c3e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1ac6152ec7becb7a29ef69b9b42ff78effb19c3e))
- **`%identity` recognized as nonexpansive** by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) improves type inference for identity functions ([#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029), [57fcefed333210bf441bba0f1eaf592c623ca61f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/57fcefed333210bf441bba0f1eaf592c623ca61f))
- **Ephemeron performance optimization** by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) eliminates duplicate status checks ([#14175](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14175), [333a5398ffe5292b45bbcae64fe3acbe1a22ecbe](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/333a5398ffe5292b45bbcae64fe3acbe1a22ecbe))
- **Test infrastructure improvement** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) shows test names before execution in ocamltest ([#14212](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14212), [64a5cdf9c64e2ec2d46b27c4a299abc1a514ba07](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/64a5cdf9c64e2ec2d46b27c4a299abc1a514ba07))
repositories.activity_summary: Focused week on runtime stability with major PRs merged and ongoing work on compiler error reporting
repositories.activity:
- **Runtime stability improvements** with critical memory model fixes for multicore programming, including TSan-related test adjustments by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- **Typechecker enhancements** with ongoing work on inclusion check error messages by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) addressing ppx-generated file confusion ([#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205))
- **Cross-platform compatibility** fixes including pthread support for NetBSD by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14208](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14208)) and variance constraint improvements by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202))
- **Code hygiene and maintenance** with integral type improvements in compaction by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#14123](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14123)) and module unpacking constraint fixes by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active discussion on module subtyping rules for variant type abbreviations
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Module subtyping discussion** by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) regarding whether to relax current rules that prohibit exporting abbreviations as variants, addressing unclear error messages when concrete types are treated as abstract ([#14204](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14204))
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on multicore safety and runtime correctness with concurrent development activity
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Multicore stability emphasis** with significant attention to memory model correctness and concurrent programming safety, particularly in weak references and ephemerons
- **Developer experience improvements** through better error messages, clearer diagnostics, and enhanced debugging support
- **Cross-platform robustness** with ongoing fixes for various Unix-like systems including NetBSD compatibility
repositories.contributors_summary: Active development by core team with contributions spanning runtime, stdlib, and tooling improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) implemented critical memory model fixes for `Weak.set` ([#14209](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14209)) and enhanced test infrastructure by showing test names before execution ([#14212](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14212))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provided better functor error messages ([#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201)) and extensive review feedback on memory model and variance-related changes
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) developed fixes for inclusion check error messages addressing ppx file name confusion ([#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205))
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) contributed integral type hygiene improvements in garbage collection compaction code ([#14123](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14123))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) made `%identity` nonexpansive ([#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029)) and fixed module unpacking constraints ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198))
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) optimized ephemeron performance by eliminating duplicate status checks ([#14175](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14175))
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) fixed pthread compatibility for NetBSD systems ([#14208](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14208))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) addressed variance check issues ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202)) and initiated discussions on module subtyping rules ([#14204](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14204))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) contributed TSan test adjustments to support recent runtime changes ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) and [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) provided comprehensive code reviews and technical feedback across multiple PRs

repositories.brief_summary: Focused on GitHub Actions infrastructure improvements, API cleanup removing duplicated functions, and bug fixes with 16 PRs merged
repositories.new_features_summary: API cleanup removing stdlib duplicates, format upgrade mechanism, rsync improvements, and enhanced error handling
repositories.new_features:
- **OpamStd library cleanup** removes functions duplicated in OCaml stdlib by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), consolidating `List`, `Map`, `Set`, `String`, and `Option` utilities ([#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442))
- **Complete format upgrade mechanism** at repository and switch level by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) enables on-the-fly upgrades and write upgrades ([#6417](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6417))
- **Enhanced error handling** for non-displayable characters in package names and versions by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640))
- **OpamLocal.rsync functions** simplified by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) changing return type from `OpamFilename.*` to `unit` ([#6658](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6658))
- **OpamSwitchState.files function** removed as it was unused ([#6662](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6662))
- **OpamHash.check_string** function added ([01a62c7e711b0a1d401d0055a8dbf16ca7d64b7b](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/01a62c7e711b0a1d401d0055a8dbf16ca7d64b7b))
- **Patch dependency constraint** updated to require stable version 3.0.0 instead of alpha by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6663](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6663))
- **Documentation improvements** in packaging guide by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) upgrading deprecated MD5 examples to SHA256 ([#6653](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6653))
- **OpamPath.Switch.Overlay docstrings** corrected by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6660](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6660))
repositories.activity_summary: Intensive GitHub Actions improvements addressing macOS builds, NixOS tests, and reverse dependencies testing infrastructure
repositories.activity:
- **GitHub Actions infrastructure** overhaul by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) with fixes for NixOS depext tests ([#6652](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6652)), macOS builds requiring rsync installation ([#6656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6656)), and script hardening with `set -ue` ([#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6648))
- **Reverse dependencies testing** implementation by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) and [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) including CI job for opam library compilation testing ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394)), false positive filtering ([#6655](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6655)), and performance improvements ([#6657](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6657))
- **Build system improvements** limiting get-changed-files action to PR context only by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6582](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6582))
- **Bug resolution** with closure of multiple issues including Windows build errors ([#5859](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5859)), argument handling with spaces ([#5673](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5673)), and macOS initialization failures ([#5581](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5581), [#5536](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5536))
- **Code maintenance** removing unused functions and cleaning up internal API inconsistencies across multiple modules
repositories.discussions_summary: Bug reports addressed source hash display issues in `opam show` and ongoing feature request discussions about extra-files deprecation
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Source hash bug** reported by [Pierre Villemot](https://github.com/Halbaroth) where `opam show` displays incorrect source-hash for pinned packages ([#6665](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6665)) with active investigation by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
- **Extra-files deprecation** discussion continues in [#5811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5811) with community input on migration strategies from extra-files to extra-sources format
- **Opam environment readonly** lock file creation issue ([#6636](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6636)) under review following dev meeting discussions
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on infrastructure robustness and API consolidation with emphasis on removing technical debt
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure modernization** with comprehensive GitHub Actions improvements addressing platform-specific issues and enhanced testing capabilities
- **API consolidation** trend removing internal duplicate functions that exist in OCaml's standard library, improving code maintainability
- **Cross-platform compatibility** improvements particularly for macOS 15 rsync compatibility and Windows build issues
- **Testing infrastructure expansion** with new reverse dependency testing capabilities for better ecosystem health monitoring
repositories.contributors_summary: Kate led with 10 PRs focusing on infrastructure and API cleanup, while R. Boujbel contributed format upgrade mechanisms and testing improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) dominated activity with 10 PRs merged including GitHub Actions fixes ([#6652](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6652), [#6656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6656), [#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6648), [#6582](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6582)), API cleanup ([#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442)), and bug fixes ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640), [#6658](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6658), [#6662](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6662), [#6660](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6660), [#6663](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6663))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) contributed format upgrade mechanism ([#6417](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6417)) and reverse dependency testing infrastructure ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394))
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) improved reverse dependency testing with false positive filtering and local pin usage ([#6655](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6655))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) enhanced packaging documentation with updated checksum examples ([#6653](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6653))
- [Pietro Cerutti](https://github.com/gahr) fixed Software Heritage URL in documentation ([#6650](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6650))

repositories.brief_summary: Typer interruption feature merged and DocumentSymbol issue closed, with ongoing multi-type location discussions
repositories.activity_summary: Typer interruption feature merged with discussion on multi-type location functionality and dependency management
repositories.activity:
- **Typer interruption functionality** merged by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) improving Merlin's performance and responsiveness ([#1920](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1920))
- **DocumentSymbol issue** closed with fix implemented on trunk, addressing the need to make DocumentSymbol available as a direct Merlin query ([#1902](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1902))
- **Multi-type location PR** closed by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) after deciding against PPX dependencies in core Merlin, focusing on avoiding complexity from ppx_jane and build dependencies ([#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952))
repositories.discussions_summary: Extensive discussion on multi-type location API design and dependency management philosophy for Merlin
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Multi-type location functionality** debate between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and maintainers on implementation approach, with [Sidharth Kshatriya](https://github.com/sidkshatriya) suggesting alignment with rust-analyzer's standard LSP textDocument/typeDefinition approach ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- **PPX dependency concerns** raised by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) and [Sonja Heinze](https://github.com/pitag-ha) about adding ppx_jane dependencies to Merlin core, citing bootstrap complexity and version compatibility issues with new OCaml compiler releases ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951), [#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952))
- **Jane Street integration** discussion on using locate-type-multi for VSCode functionality while maintaining Merlin's lightweight dependency profile ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on performance improvements while maintaining minimal dependencies and compatibility with OCaml compiler updates
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance and responsiveness** focus with typer interruption feature addressing long-running operations in Merlin ([#1920](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1920))
- **LSP standard compatibility** discussions around aligning Merlin's multi-type location features with rust-analyzer's approach using standard textDocument/typeDefinition requests ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- **Dependency minimalism** philosophy reinforced through rejection of PPX dependencies to maintain Merlin's role in OCaml ecosystem bootstrap process ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951), [#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952))
repositories.contributors_summary: Xavier Van de Woestyne merged typer interruption, Liam Stevenson developed multi-type location features, with input from maintainers
repositories.contributors:
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) merged the **typer interruption feature** improving Merlin's performance characteristics and closed the DocumentSymbol issue with trunk implementation ([#1920](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1920), [#1902](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1902))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) developed **multi-type location functionality** for Jane Street VSCode integration, authored detailed PRs for locate-type-multi query and query protocol refactoring before closing them due to dependency concerns ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951), [#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952))
- [Sonja Heinze](https://github.com/pitag-ha) provided **technical review feedback** on PPX dependency implications and participated in architectural discussions about Merlin's dependency philosophy ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951), [#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) contributed **detailed analysis** of PPX dependency risks for OCaml compiler compatibility and ecosystem bootstrap concerns ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- [Sidharth Kshatriya](https://github.com/sidkshatriya) provided **LSP compatibility perspective** suggesting alignment with rust-analyzer's standard textDocument/typeDefinition approach for better editor support ([#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))

repositories.brief_summary: High activity week with new CLI features, bug fixes for exec --watch, release coordination for 3.20.2, and extensive codebase refactoring
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced dune describe opam-files with --files flag, improved cram test timeout handling, and project-aware dune format-dune-file behavior
repositories.new_features:
- Enhanced **`dune describe opam-files`** command with new `--files` flag for printing only opam file names line by line, improving automation and scripting workflows [#9793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9793)
- Improved **cram test timeout handling** by including the specific shell command that caused timeouts in error messages, helping developers debug failed tests [#12307](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12307)
- Enhanced **`dune format-dune-file`** to respect the Dune language version of the current project, falling back to latest version when no project context exists [#11865](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11865)
- Fixed **`include_subdirs qualified`** dependency resolution by properly including module aliases in transitive dependency closures, resolving build failures in sandboxed environments [#12299](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12299)
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml separate compilation** regression with `modules_without_implementation` affecting JavaScript compilation workflows [#12320](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12320)
- Fixed **cram test directory cleanup** by removing empty `.cram.test.t` directories during test execution, preventing test pollution [#12329](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12329)
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive bootstrap refactoring, release preparation for 3.20.2 with critical bug fixes, and platform support improvements including Cygwin compatibility
repositories.activity:
- **Bootstrap system refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) with module name type introduction and build configuration improvements across multiple PRs ([#12276](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12276), [#12311](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12311), [#12313](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12313))
- **Release coordination** for Dune 3.20.2 led by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) and [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) with backport management and changelog updates ([#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328), [#12325](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12325))
- **Virtual libraries refactoring** representing virtual libraries via `Lib_kind.t` with internal API changes affecting library representation ([#12276](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12276))
- **Testing infrastructure improvements** including cram test lexer enhancements, test organization cleanup, and new edge case coverage ([#12307](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12307), [#12329](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12329))
- **Platform support enhancements** with Cygwin compatibility fixes addressing Blake3 implementation issues ([#12325](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12325))
- **Docker image publishing** workflow implementation enabling automated container distribution with releases ([#12252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12252))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active discussions around exec --watch regression, Docker base image strategy, and release timing coordination
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **`dune exec --watch` regression** discussion by [Christian Ulrich](https://github.com/royneary) reporting broken long-running process handling in 3.20.1, with investigation and proposed fix by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12323](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12323), [#12360](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12360))
- **Docker base image strategy** discussion by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) exploring approaches for dune pkg container distribution, considering GitHub Actions integration versus separate repository maintenance ([#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177))
- **Release timing coordination** between [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) and [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) regarding 3.20.2 release schedule and feature deferrals to 3.20.3 ([#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328))
- **Cygwin platform support** coordination addressing compilation failures and Blake3 implementation compatibility issues ([#12325](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12325))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on quality improvements, platform compatibility, and developer experience enhancements rather than major new features
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Quality-first development** with extensive bug fixing and testing infrastructure improvements taking priority over new feature development
- **Platform compatibility emphasis** with dedicated effort on Cygwin support and cross-platform build reliability ([#12325](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12325))
- **Developer experience improvements** through better error messages, enhanced CLI flags, and more informative test failure reporting ([#12307](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12307), [#9793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9793))
- **Release process maturation** with systematic backport management, comprehensive tracking, and coordinated release planning ([#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328))
- **Containerization adoption** with Docker workflow implementation supporting modern deployment patterns ([#12252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12252), [#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177))
repositories.issues_summary: Timed-out cram tests should offer partial promotions for better debugging experience
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Partial promotion for timed-out cram tests** to allow developers to see test progress up to the timeout point, improving debugging workflow for long-running tests ([#12343](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12343))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core maintainers focusing on stability, platform support, and release preparation
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led extensive bootstrap refactoring and build system improvements, implemented virtual library changes, and provided code reviews across multiple areas ([#12276](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12276), [#12311](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12311), [#12313](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12313))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) managed 3.20.2 release coordination, investigated and proposed fixes for exec --watch regression, and contributed to testing infrastructure improvements ([#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328), [#12323](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12323), [#12360](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12360))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) supported release preparation with backport coordination and build system fixes, collaborated on release timing decisions ([#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328))
- [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) contributed to documentation improvements and participated in tutorial development discussions ([#10793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10793))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) worked on package management improvements and system integration features
- [Christian Ulrich](https://github.com/royneary) reported critical exec --watch regression and provided detailed reproduction steps and testing feedback ([#12323](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12323))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) initiated Docker base image strategy discussion and explored containerization approaches for dune pkg ([#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177))

repositories.brief_summary: Content updates and documentation improvements across OCaml Planet, changelog releases, and contributor guidelines.
repositories.new_features_summary: Documentation clarification for Planet RSS feeds and removal of outdated job listings.

repositories.brief_summary: Active week with 30 merged PRs introducing chess ecosystem packages, major updates to Dune 3.20.1 and crypto libraries, plus Windows platform support improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: New chess ecosystem packages (PGN parser, Lichess/Chess.com APIs), Dune 3.20.1 updates, mirage-crypto 2.0.2 security improvements, Windows platform support expansion
repositories.new_features:
- **Chess ecosystem packages** introduced by [Boris Novoselov](https://github.com/Ckaf) with comprehensive chess tooling including PGN parsing, board visualization, Zobrist hashing, and API clients for Lichess and Chess.com platforms ([#28404](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28404))
- **Dune 3.20.1 release** by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) with 15 packages updated, fixing runtest-js dependencies and path interpretation issues ([#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397))
- **Mirage-crypto 2.0.2 security update** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) across 6 packages, addressing ECDSA public key compression vulnerabilities ([#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382))
- **Windows platform support expansion** by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with GTK2/GTK3 support for MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin environments ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389), [#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376))
- **LWT 5.9.2 improvements** by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) for promises and event-driven I/O functionality ([#28384](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28384))
- **SMT solver ecosystem updates** with smtml 0.10.0 frontend improvements ([#28399](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28399)) and smtml 0.1.2 revival for owi compatibility ([#28409](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28409))
- **Protocol-9p 2.1.0 updates** with cmdliner 1.1.0 compatibility and sexplib bounds removal across 3 packages ([#28394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28394))
- **NetBSD support addition** for conf-libev 4-13 with pkgsrc integration ([#28408](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28408))
repositories.activity_summary: Package maintenance dominated with dependency bound fixes, PPX ecosystem compatibility updates, URL corrections for broken packages, and fswatch deprecation due to packaging issues
repositories.activity:
- **Package dependency management** improvements across multiple libraries with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) leading fixes for PPX rapper bounds ([#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371)), pg_query architecture constraints ([#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372)), and owi SMT solver compatibility ([#28400](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28400))
- **PPX ecosystem stability** maintained by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) with ppxlib compatibility fixes addressing recent version changes ([#28388](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28388))
- **Package infrastructure maintenance** including broken URL fixes for shuttle_http and shuttle_websocket packages ([#28407](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28407)), and contact information updates for ocaml-sfml ([#28356](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28356))
- **Library deprecation handling** with fswatch and conf-fswatch packages flagged as deprecated due to unresolved Debian/Ubuntu packaging issues affecting development usage ([#28396](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28396))
- **Major version releases** including GitHub API 4.5.0 with 4 packages ([#28390](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28390)), FFmpeg bindings 1.2.6 with 8 packages ([#28401](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28401)), and Ortac 0.7.2 bugfix release ([#28403](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28403))
- **Coq ecosystem updates** with coq-waterproof packages for both Coq 8.17 and 9.0 versions ([#28402](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28402), [#28405](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28405))
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on cross-platform compatibility, proactive dependency management, and ecosystem maintenance with emphasis on Windows development support
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform development focus** with substantial Windows support improvements across GUI and audio libraries, enabling better Windows development experiences for OCaml projects
- **Proactive dependency management** pattern showing maintainers actively addressing version bounds and compatibility issues before they become blocking problems for users
- **SMT solver ecosystem stabilization** with coordinated updates between smtml, owi, and related verification tools to maintain compatibility during interface changes
- **Chess and gaming library development** emergence with comprehensive tooling for chess applications, suggesting growing interest in OCaml for game development
- **Security-first updates** particularly visible in mirage-crypto releases prioritizing cryptographic vulnerability fixes
- **Ecosystem health maintenance** through systematic deprecation of problematic packages and proactive URL/contact information updates
repositories.contributors_summary: 24 unique contributors led by Jan Midtgaard with cross-platform support work and Hannes Mehnert with crypto/networking updates, plus active package maintenance across the community
repositories.contributors:
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) contributed 7 merged PRs focusing on **Windows platform support expansion** with GTK2/GTK3 integration ([#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389), [#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376)), **dependency bound fixes** for PPX and SMT tools ([#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371), [#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372), [#28400](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28400)), and **package maintenance** work ([#28407](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28407))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) delivered 6 PRs with **mirage-crypto security updates** ([#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382)), **networking library releases** including protocol-9p 2.1.0 and hvsock 3.1.0 ([#28394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28394), [#28393](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28393)), **SMT toolchain maintenance** ([#28409](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28409)), and **NetBSD platform support** ([#28408](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28408))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) released **Dune 3.20.1** with 15 package updates addressing build system improvements ([#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397))
- [Boris Novoselov](https://github.com/Ckaf) introduced the **chess ecosystem** with PGN parser and API clients for major chess platforms ([#28404](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28404))
- [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) contributed **LWT 5.9.2 improvements** ([#28384](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28384)) and **PPX compatibility fixes** ([#28388](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28388))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) released **GitHub API 4.5.0** with 4 package updates ([#28390](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28390))
- [Jean-Christophe Filliatre](https://github.com/backtracking) contributed **bitv 2.1** bit vector library update ([#28391](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28391))
- [@aliheidary1381](https://github.com/aliheidary1381) added **prolect 1.1.3** package with manual submission due to opam-publish issues ([#28395](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28395))
- Additional contributors included [@toots](https://github.com/toots) with **FFmpeg 1.2.6 bindings** ([#28401](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28401)), [@n-osborne](https://github.com/n-osborne) with **Ortac 0.7.2** ([#28403](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28403)), [@geonot](https://github.com/geonot) with **OpenCage 1.0.5** ([#28381](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28381)), and [@tmcgilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) with **opam-compiler 0.2.1** supporting GitHub URL sources ([#28374](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28374))

repositories.brief_summary: Bug fixes for function comparison purity annotations, WASM call graph analysis, and Unix.times implementation
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed comparison function purity annotations and WASM call graph analysis for better optimization accuracy
repositories.new_features:
- **Comparison function purity fix** reverting incorrect `mutable` annotations on `caml_compare` and related functions since they can raise `Invalid_argument` exceptions ([#2092](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2092))
- **WASM call graph analysis improvement** ensuring exact call analysis is coherent with code generation for better closure optimization ([#2093](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2093))
- **WASM Unix.times fix** correcting the system time component to return 0 instead of user time when using `performance.now()` fallback ([#2096](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2096))
repositories.activity_summary: CI infrastructure improvements and test stabilization for cross-platform compatibility
repositories.activity:
- **CI workflow enhancements** updating GitHub Actions configuration to pin lwt version 5.9.2 and address Dune 3.20 compatibility issues on Windows ([#2095](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2095))
- **Test suite robustness** improvements to make tests independent of build directory state, preventing failures from previous runs ([#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090))
- **Windows compatibility work** addressing CRLF line ending handling issues, though currently blocked on upstream ppx_expect dependency ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2087))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussions around function comparison semantics and build system improvements
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Function equality behavior changes** discussion in [#2089](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2089) about test failures when using `--effects=cps` or `--effects=double-translation`, where function lifting affects comparison results
- **Filesystem build tool** inquiry in [#2091](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2091) about preserving directory structure with `build-fs` command and compatibility with Dune's `source_tree` option
- **Purity annotation semantics** clarification of the difference between `mutator`, `mutable`, and `pure` annotations for JavaScript runtime primitives in [#2092](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2092)
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on WASM backend optimization and cross-platform build system stability
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WASM optimization refinement** continued improvement of closure optimization passes with better call graph analysis for more accurate dead code elimination
- **Cross-platform CI stability** ongoing work to ensure consistent test results across different operating systems and Dune versions
- **Runtime behavior consistency** careful attention to maintaining OCaml semantics in JavaScript/WASM runtimes, particularly around exception handling
repositories.contributors_summary: Three core maintainers collaborated on compiler bug fixes and CI improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) identified and fixed the function comparison purity regression ([#2092](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2092)), reported the effects-related test failure ([#2089](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2089)), and improved test robustness ([#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) fixed the WASM call graph analysis issue ([#2093](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2093)), resolved the Unix.times implementation ([#2096](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2096)), and provided technical guidance on purity annotations
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) addressed CI pipeline issues ([#2095](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2095)), worked on Windows compatibility ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2087)), and provided code review feedback across multiple PRs

repositories.brief_summary: Major backend optimizations with new DWARF debugging flag, affine switch recognition, and atomic API simplifications
repositories.new_features_summary: New `-gdwarf-pedantic` compiler flag, affine switch optimization, atomic API consolidation, and DWARF testing improvements
repositories.new_features:
- New **`-gdwarf-pedantic` compiler flag** enables pedantic DWARF error checking with fatal errors instead of silent fallbacks ([1d3e7ef](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/1d3e7ef8a91f6c2211db49dcc1add3cf9a94c3eb))
- **Affine switch recognition** in flambda2 optimizer prevents middle-end from blocking later affine switch optimizations ([#4571](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4571))
- **Atomic API consolidation** removes separate `Atomic.Contended` module, streamlining atomic operations with simplified mode annotations ([e801519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e801519d4472e656ae6077c46ec5be1fc3a433ce))
- **Queue API mode improvements** add `@ local` annotations to all operations for better locality constraints ([e801519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e801519d4472e656ae6077c46ec5be1fc3a433ce))
- **Mutex.protect mode refinement** now accepts `@ local once` functions instead of just `@ local` ([e801519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e801519d4472e656ae6077c46ec5be1fc3a433ce))
- **Enhanced DWARF test coverage** with comprehensive test suites for callstack debugging, parameter tracking, and stepping through code ([2c36d8e](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/2c36d8ec1ed7f9e46b5dd1573603886101277e55))
repositories.activity_summary: Backend optimizations focused on type safety, polling fixes, memory management improvements, and prologue validation
repositories.activity:
- **Type safety enhancements** making `Lambda.static_label` abstract with end-to-end type safety across the entire compiler pipeline by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4607](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4607))
- **Reaper optimizations** preserving tail calls in tail calling loops and preventing demotion of direct calls in zero-alloc functions ([#4590](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4590), [#4572](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4572))
- **Mode system improvements** unzipping `Mode.Modality.Value` and refining `Bigarray` and `Array` mode annotations by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#4481](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4481), [#4470](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4470), [#4563](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4563))
- **Memory management fixes** including GC root mishandling bug in memprof.c and improvements to `Domain.Safe.DLS.access` callback handling ([#4580](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4580), [#4557](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4557))
- **SIMD intrinsics cleanup** for scalar `caml_simd` operations and extended separability checking improvements ([#4458](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4458), [#4575](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4575))
- **Development infrastructure** additions including prologue validator tests and CLAUDE.md documentation for AI assistant development ([#4585](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4585), [#4592](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4592), [#4587](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4587))
- **Unix module improvements** annotating write functions to accept shared buffers ([#4615](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4615))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on backend performance, type safety, mode system refinements, and enhanced debugging capabilities
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Backend optimization momentum** with continued work on shrink-wrapping, prologue validation, and tail call preservation showing systematic performance improvement efforts
- **Mode system maturation** with ongoing refinements to atomic operations, queue interfaces, and array/bigarray annotations indicating stabilization of the mode system
- **Enhanced debugging support** through DWARF improvements, pedantic error checking, and comprehensive test coverage reflecting focus on developer experience
- **Type safety reinforcement** across compiler internals with abstract types and end-to-end safety checks showing architectural strengthening efforts
repositories.issues_summary: SIMD compatibility issue reported affecting AVX hardware without AVX2 support
repositories.good_first_issues: - **SIMD instruction compatibility** investigation needed for AMD64 SIMD instructions emitting AVX2 on AVX hardware, reported by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4577](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4577))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from 22 developers across compiler optimizations, API improvements, and testing infrastructure
repositories.contributors:
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) led multiple efforts including polling safe map fixes ([#4574](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4574)), Lambda.static_label type safety improvements ([#4607](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4607)), and shrink-wrapping benchmark testing ([#4613](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4613), [#4614](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4614))
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) contributed mode system refinements across Array and Bigarray modules ([#4470](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4470), [#4563](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4563), [#4589](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4589))
- [@cfalas](https://github.com/cfalas) implemented prologue validation testing and shrink-wrapping optimizations ([#4585](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4585), [#4601](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4601), [#4616](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4616))
- [@bclement-ocp](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) fixed affine switch recognition in flambda2 ([#4571](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4571))

- [@gretay-js](https://github.com/gretay-js) added CLAUDE.md documentation for AI assistant development ([#4592](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4592))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) reported SIMD compatibility issues ([#4577](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4577)) and contributed SIMD intrinsics cleanup ([#4458](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4458))
- [@mshinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) collaborated on reaper optimizations ([#4590](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4590), [#4572](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4572)) and polling fixes ([#4574](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4574))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) worked on preserving mode locations in typedtree ([#4576](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4576))
- [@NickBarnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) contributed additional testing and development infrastructure improvements

repositories.brief_summary: Added comprehensive odoc toolchain packages and patched eio library for Oxcaml compatibility
repositories.new_features_summary: Complete odoc documentation toolchain with driver, parser, markdown support, and patched eio async I/O library
repositories.new_features:
- **Odoc documentation toolchain** integration with full package suite including `odoc`, `odoc-parser`, `odoc-driver`, `odoc-md`, and `sherlodoc` packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Eio async I/O library** added with platform-specific packages `eio`, `eio_posix`, `eio_linux`, and `eio_main` for effect-based direct-style I/O ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Ocaml-lsp-server compatibility** improvements with patch for current `odoc-parser` integration ([7ced23c5d](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7ced23c5d63a57ac73e250298adbdbc3de3cd629))
- **Git+https source URLs** migration for better maintainability instead of patch files for `mdx` package ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
repositories.activity_summary: Focus on documentation toolchain completion and source management improvements with repository URL standardization
repositories.activity:
- **Documentation ecosystem** integration work by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) establishing complete odoc toolchain with cross-package dependencies for Oxcaml development ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Source management** improvements moving from patch-based approach to direct git repository references with checksums for easier maintenance ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), [#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **Cross-repository coordination** with references to [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm)'s eio fork for Oxcaml-specific patches until upstream integration
repositories.trends_summary: Shift towards comprehensive documentation tooling and standardized source repository management
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Documentation-first approach** with complete odoc toolchain integration suggesting focus on improving developer experience and API documentation quality
- **Git-based source management** replacing patch files with direct repository references and checksums for more maintainable package definitions
- **Cross-repository collaboration** between oxcaml organization and individual maintainer forks for testing and integration before upstream contributions
repositories.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam drove the documentation toolchain integration and source management improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) implemented the complete odoc documentation toolchain including `odoc-driver`, `sherlodoc`, and related packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), added the eio async I/O library with platform-specific variants ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), updated mdx package to use git+https source URLs ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), and patched ocaml-lsp-server for odoc-parser compatibility
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) provided the eio patches referenced in the package sources for Oxcaml-specific modifications

repositories.discussions_summary: Ongoing investigation of io_uring-related system call interruption in parallel stdout operations
repositories.notable_discussions:
- Investigation of **"Interrupted system call" error** affecting parallel stdout writes with io_uring backend involving [Wildfield](https://github.com/wildfield), [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5), and [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))
- **Root cause analysis** traced the issue to liburing behavior with concurrent WRITEV operations across multiple domains, with detailed uring trace analysis provided ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))
- **Proposed solution** includes adding io_uring setup flags support to ocaml-uring library as potential workaround for the kernel-level issue ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors actively investigating and debugging a complex io_uring concurrency issue
repositories.contributors:
- [Wildfield](https://github.com/wildfield) provided detailed issue reproduction with code examples and io_uring trace analysis for parallel stdout operations ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) investigated the underlying liburing behavior and provided debugging guidance with bpftrace analysis tools ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) contributed to isolating the issue to the io_uring layer with minimal reproduction examples ([#788](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/788))

group_summaries.brief_summary: High-activity week with 30 package releases, chess ecosystem additions, security updates, and coordinated release communications
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Chess ecosystem packages, Dune 3.20.1 updates, mirage-crypto security improvements, Windows platform support, LSP tools announcement
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Chess ecosystem packages** introduced by [Boris Novoselov](https://github.com/Ckaf) with comprehensive chess tooling including PGN parsing, board visualization, and API clients for major platforms ([ocaml/opam-repository#28404](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28404))
- **Dune 3.20.1 release** by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) with 15 packages updated, fixing runtest-js dependencies and path interpretation issues ([ocaml/opam-repository#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397))
- **Mirage-crypto 2.0.2 security update** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) across 6 packages, addressing ECDSA public key compression vulnerabilities ([ocaml/opam-repository#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382))
- **Windows platform support expansion** by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with GTK2/GTK3 support for MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin environments ([ocaml/opam-repository#28387](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28387), [ocaml/opam-repository#28389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28389), [ocaml/opam-repository#28376](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28376))
- **LSP tooling announcement** with ocaml-eglot Emacs support featured on ocaml.org by [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080))
- **Enhanced contributor documentation** with clarification of Planet RSS feed requirements ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3283](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3283))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package management activity** reached 30 merged PRs in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) covering new features, security updates, and cross-platform improvements
- **Community content expansion** in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) through blog syndication, event announcements, and contributor documentation improvements
- **Cross-platform development focus** with substantial Windows support improvements and tooling announcements
- **Security-first updates** particularly visible in cryptographic libraries and systematic vulnerability addressing
group_summaries.activity_summary: Package dependency management, PPX ecosystem maintenance, automated content updates, and systematic infrastructure improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **Package dependency management** led by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) with PPX rapper bounds fixes ([ocaml/opam-repository#28371](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28371)), pg_query architecture constraints ([ocaml/opam-repository#28372](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28372)), and SMT solver compatibility ([ocaml/opam-repository#28400](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28400))
- **Community blog expansion** with [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) adding Mark Elvers' blog ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3277](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3277)) and [Chukwuma Akunyili](https://github.com/aguluman) contributing their blog to Planet ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3260](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3260))
- **Library deprecation handling** with fswatch packages flagged due to packaging issues ([ocaml/opam-repository#28396](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28396))
- **Automated content updates** through regular GitHub Actions for blog posts and video scraping ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3271](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3271), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3276](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3276), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3279](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3279))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Coordinated Dune 3.20.1 release** by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) with package updates in [ocaml/opam-repository#28397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28397) and release announcement in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3274](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3274)
- **Tool discovery workflow** with LSP tooling (ocaml-eglot) featured on [ocaml/ocaml.org#3080](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3080) supporting packages available in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository)
- **Documentation coordination** between package contributor guidelines in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) and package submission processes in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Enhanced cross-platform compatibility** with substantial Windows development support improvements across GUI libraries and build tools
- **Security-first maintenance** approach visible in proactive cryptographic vulnerability fixes and systematic security updates
- **Community content aggregation growth** showing increased blog contributions from diverse global contributors
- **Ecosystem health maintenance** through systematic deprecation of problematic packages and proactive dependency management
- **Tool discovery integration** between package availability and community documentation platforms

group_summaries.brief_summary: High activity in Dune and OPAM with new CLI features, API cleanup, release preparation, and cross-platform compatibility fixes
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Enhanced Dune CLI tools, OPAM API consolidation, improved error handling, and JavaScript/WASM compiler optimizations
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Enhanced [ocaml/dune#9793](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9793) describe opam-files** with new `--files` flag for printing opam file names line by line, improving automation workflows
- **Improved [ocaml/dune#12307](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12307) cram test timeout handling** including specific shell commands in error messages for better debugging
- **Enhanced [ocaml/dune#11865](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11865) format-dune-file** to respect project Dune language version, falling back to latest when no context exists
- **Fixed [ocaml/dune#12299](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12299) include_subdirs qualified** dependency resolution by properly including module aliases in transitive closures
- **OPAM API cleanup [ocaml/opam#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442)** removing functions duplicated in OCaml stdlib by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) for `List`, `Map`, `Set`, `String`, and `Option` utilities
- **Complete [ocaml/opam#6417](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6417) format upgrade mechanism** at repository and switch level enabling on-the-fly upgrades
- **Enhanced [ocaml/opam#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640) error handling** for non-displayable characters in package names and versions
- **Fixed [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2092](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2092) comparison function purity** reverting incorrect annotations on `caml_compare` functions
- **Improved [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2093](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2093) WASM call graph analysis** for coherent closure optimization
- **Added [ocaml/odoc#1383](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1383) opam 2.5 compatibility** using standard library `String.starts_with`
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **High development velocity** across core tools with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) leading activity through CLI enhancements, API cleanup, and release preparation
- **Quality-first approach** emphasizing bug fixes, testing improvements, and platform compatibility over major feature additions
- **Release coordination** for [ocaml/dune#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328) Dune 3.20.2 addressing critical exec --watch regression and Cygwin compatibility issues
- **Infrastructure modernization** with comprehensive GitHub Actions improvements addressing macOS builds, Windows compatibility, and enhanced testing capabilities
- **Cross-platform stability** focus with dedicated work on Cygwin support, Windows build issues, and platform-specific testing enhancements
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive refactoring, testing improvements, and infrastructure work supporting release stability and developer experience
group_summaries.activity:
- **Bootstrap system refactoring** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) with module type introduction and build configuration improvements ([ocaml/dune#12276](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12276), [ocaml/dune#12311](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12311))
- **Typer interruption functionality** merged in [ocaml/merlin#1920](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1920) by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) improving performance and responsiveness
- **GitHub Actions infrastructure** overhaul in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) fixing NixOS tests ([ocaml/opam#6652](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6652)), macOS builds ([ocaml/opam#6656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6656)), and script hardening ([ocaml/opam#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6648))
- **Reverse dependencies testing** implementation in [ocaml/opam#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394) including CI job for library compilation testing and performance improvements
- **CI workflow enhancements** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2095](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2095) addressing Dune 3.20 compatibility and Windows issues
- **Test suite robustness** improvements in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2090](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2090) making tests independent of build directory state
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Dune 3.20.2 release impact** affecting multiple repositories with [ocaml/dune#12323](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12323) exec --watch regression requiring coordination with downstream tools and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2095](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2095) CI compatibility fixes
- **OPAM and Odoc coordination** on opam 2.5 compatibility with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) contributing [ocaml/odoc#1383](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1383) String.starts_with migration matching [ocaml/opam#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442) stdlib consolidation efforts
- **Merlin and Dune integration** discussions around [ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951) multi-type location functionality considering impact on Dune build dependencies and PPX compatibility
- **Cross-platform testing** coordination with GitHub Actions improvements in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) addressing similar Windows and macOS compatibility challenges
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Exec --watch regression** in [ocaml/dune#12323](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12323) reported by [Christian Ulrich](https://github.com/royneary) with broken long-running process handling in 3.20.1, investigated by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) for 3.20.2 fix ([ocaml/dune#12360](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12360))
- **Multi-type location API** debate in [ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951) between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and maintainers on PPX dependencies, with [Sidharth Kshatriya](https://github.com/sidkshatriya) suggesting LSP standard alignment
- **PPX dependency philosophy** discussion in [ocaml/merlin#1952](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1952) with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) and [Sonja Heinze](https://github.com/pitag-ha) raising bootstrap complexity concerns about ppx_jane integration
- **Source hash display bug** in [ocaml/opam#6665](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6665) reported by [Pierre Villemot](https://github.com/Halbaroth) where `opam show` displays incorrect source-hash for pinned packages
- **Function equality behavior** discussion in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2089](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2089) about test failures with `--effects=cps` where function lifting affects comparison results
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure-first development** with comprehensive CI improvements across [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam), [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) prioritizing build system reliability
- **API consolidation movement** removing technical debt through [ocaml/opam#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442) stdlib duplicate removal and internal API cleanup across repositories
- **Cross-platform compatibility emphasis** with dedicated Windows and macOS support work addressing Cygwin issues ([ocaml/dune#12325](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12325)), rsync compatibility, and CRLF handling
- **Performance optimization focus** with [ocaml/merlin#1920](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1920) typer interruption and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2093](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2093) WASM call graph improvements enhancing developer experience
- **Release process maturation** with systematic [ocaml/dune#12328](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12328) backport management and coordinated release planning demonstrating ecosystem stability priorities

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major oxcaml compiler optimizations, complete documentation toolchain integration, and Jane Street v0.18 preview release
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New DWARF debugging flag, affine switch optimization, atomic API changes, complete odoc toolchain, and two new Jane Street packages
group_summaries.new_features:
- **New `-gdwarf-pedantic` compiler flag** enables pedantic DWARF error checking with fatal errors instead of silent fallbacks ([oxcaml/oxcaml@1d3e7ef](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/1d3e7ef8a91f6c2211db49dcc1add3cf9a94c3eb))
- **Affine switch recognition** in flambda2 optimizer prevents middle-end from blocking later affine switch optimizations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4571](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4571))
- **Atomic API consolidation** removes separate `Atomic.Contended` module, streamlining atomic operations with simplified mode annotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml@e801519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e801519d4472e656ae6077c46ec5be1fc3a433ce))
- **Odoc documentation toolchain** integration with full package suite including `odoc`, `odoc-parser`, `odoc-driver`, `odoc-md`, and `sherlodoc` packages ([oxcaml/opam-repository#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Eio async I/O library** added with platform-specific packages `eio`, `eio_posix`, `eio_linux`, and `eio_main` for effect-based direct-style I/O ([oxcaml/opam-repository#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **ppx_box package** - New PPX syntax extension library for Jane Street's OCaml ecosystem ([janestreet/opam-repository@2bd4fc7](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2bd4fc7121ad1a58419f2c5f6eba929e044b4041))
- **unique package** - New library providing uniqueness functionality with OCaml 5.2.0+ requirement ([janestreet/opam-repository@2bd4fc7](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2bd4fc7121ad1a58419f2c5f6eba929e044b4041))
- **Disabled spurious probe name error** that was incorrectly reported when using `%probe_is_enabled` in OCaml code ([oxcaml/merlin#181](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/181))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Compiler development momentum** with [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) and [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) driving major backend optimizations including DWARF debugging improvements, type safety enhancements, and mode system refinements across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Documentation infrastructure completion** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) establishing comprehensive odoc toolchain and eio async I/O library in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) for improved developer experience
- **Editor integration improvements** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) resolving user-reported probe error issues in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) while continuing work on VSCode syntax hover functionality
- **Jane Street ecosystem update** with automated v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 release adding two new packages across 281 total packages in [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository)
- **No activity** recorded in [oxcaml/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/js_of_ocaml) during this period
group_summaries.activity_summary: Backend type safety improvements, memory management fixes, source management standardization, and comprehensive ecosystem releases
group_summaries.activity:
- **Type safety reinforcement** across compiler internals with [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) making `Lambda.static_label` abstract for end-to-end type safety ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4607](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4607))
- **Memory management improvements** including GC root mishandling fixes in memprof.c and Domain.Safe.DLS callback handling enhancements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4580](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4580), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4557](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4557))
- **Mode system maturation** with [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) refining Bigarray and Array mode annotations, and Queue API improvements with `@ local` annotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4470](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4470), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4563](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4563))
- **Source management standardization** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) moving from patch-based approach to direct git repository references with checksums ([oxcaml/opam-repository#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **Complete ecosystem synchronization** across all Jane Street libraries maintaining version consistency from v0.18~preview.130.48+372 to v0.18~preview.130.50+1016 ([janestreet/opam-repository@2bd4fc7](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/commit/2bd4fc7121ad1a58419f2c5f6eba929e044b4041))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Documentation toolchain coordination** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) with odoc integration supporting compiler development workflow through comprehensive API documentation ([oxcaml/opam-repository#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Eio library patching collaboration** with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) providing oxcaml-specific patches referenced in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) package sources until upstream integration
- **Upstream coordination efforts** with [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) query protocol refactoring work being contributed back to the main OCaml Merlin project ([oxcaml/merlin#149](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/149))
- **Ocaml-lsp-server compatibility** improvements in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) with patches for current odoc-parser integration supporting editor functionality ([oxcaml/opam-repository@7ced23c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7ced23c5d63a57ac73e250298adbdbc3de3cd629))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Backend optimization focus** with systematic work on shrink-wrapping, prologue validation, and tail call preservation showing coordinated performance improvement efforts across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Mode system stabilization** with ongoing refinements to atomic operations, queue interfaces, and array/bigarray annotations indicating architectural maturation in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Documentation-first development** approach with complete odoc toolchain integration in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) supporting improved API documentation quality across the ecosystem
- **Git-based package management** transition in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) replacing patch files with direct repository references for more maintainable package definitions
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through DWARF improvements, pedantic error checking, and comprehensive test coverage reflecting focus on developer experience in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Editor integration improvements** with enhanced VSCode functionality through new type location commands and syntax hover features in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Active week with significant memory model fixes, stdlib additions, and typechecker improvements merged to trunk
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Added List.split_map function, fixed Weak.set memory model, improved functor error messages, %identity nonexpansive
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Memory model fix** for `Weak.set` by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) addresses data race vulnerabilities in concurrent usage ([ocaml/ocaml#14209](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14209))
- **New `List.split_map` function** added to stdlib by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) that combines map and split operations without intermediate allocations ([ocaml/ocaml#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185))
- **Functor error message improvement** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provides clearer diagnostics when a functor is its own unsafe functor ([ocaml/ocaml#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201))
- **`%identity` recognized as nonexpansive** by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) improves type inference for identity functions ([ocaml/ocaml#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029))
- **Ephemeron performance optimization** by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) eliminates duplicate status checks ([ocaml/ocaml#14175](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14175))
- **Test infrastructure improvement** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) shows test names before execution in ocamltest ([ocaml/ocaml#14212](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14212))
